Package mdd

Class MDD

  • java.lang.Object
    • mdd.MDD
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Allocable, Freeable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CostMDD, PMDD
    public class MDD
extends java.lang.Object
implements Allocable
    The class representing the MDD.
    Contains a root node that is not null, a set of layers and a tt node if the MDD has been reduce.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      (package private) static class  MDD.Allocator
      The allocator that is in charge of the MDD type.
      When not specified, the allocator has an initial capacity of 16.

      • copy

        public MDD copy​(MDD copy,
                int offset,
                int start,
                int stop)
        Create a copy of the given MDD from layer start to stop onto the given MDD. Add the copy of the nodes to the given MDD at the same layer + the given offset. Example : start = 1, stop = 3, offset = 2 will copy the layer 1 onto the layer 3 of the copy MDD, layer 2 on layer 4 and layer 3 on layer 5.
        Parameters:
        copy - The MDD used to stock the copy
        offset - The offset of the copy
        start - The first layer to copy
        stop - The last layer to copy
        Returns:
        A copy of the current MDD from layer start to layer stop.

      • copy

        public MDD copy​(MDD copy,
                Node root,
                int offset)
        Create a copy of the given MDD from root to tt onto the given MDD. Add the copy of the nodes to the given MDD at the same layer + the given offset.
        Parameters:
        copy - The MDD used to stock the copy
        root - The root node of the MDD
        offset - The offset of the copy
        Returns:
        A copy of the current MDD from root to tt

      • replace

        public void replace​(MapOf<java.lang.Integer,​SetOf<java.lang.Integer>> mapping)
        Replace the values of all arcs according to the given mapping. For instance, you want to replace all arcs with value 0 by [1, 2] : all you have to do is make a mapping 0 â†’ {1, 2} and give it as an input.
        Parameters:
        mapping - The mapping of the values

      • replace

        public void replace​(MapOf<java.lang.Integer,​SetOf<java.lang.Integer>> mapping,
                    int start,
                    int stop)
        Replace the values of all arcs according to the given mapping, from layer start to layer stop. For instance, you want to replace all arcs with value 0 by [1, 2] : all you have to do is make a mapping 0 â†’ {1, 2} and give it as an input.
        Parameters:
        mapping - The mapping of the values
        start - The first layer of the operation
        stop - The last layer of the operation

      • replace

        public void replace​(MapOf<java.lang.Integer,​SetOf<java.lang.Integer>>[] mapping,
                    int start,
                    int stop)
        Replace the values of all arcs according to the given mapping, from layer start to layer stop. For instance, you want to replace all arcs with value 0 by [1, 2] : all you have to do is make a mapping 0 â†’ {1, 2} and give it as an input. This function takes an array of map, so that you can have a map for each layer. mapping[0] corresponds to the mapping for layer "start".
        Parameters:
        mapping - The mapping of the values
        start - The first layer of the operation
        stop - The last layer of the operation

      • replace

        public void replace​(SetOf<java.lang.Integer> V0,
                    SetOf<java.lang.Integer> V1)
        Replace the values of all arcs according to the map : [ 0 â†’ V0, 1 â†’ V1 ]. Simplification of the main function to use with binary MDDs.
        Parameters:
        V0 - All values associated to 0
        V1 - All values associated to 1

      • randomWalk

        public int[] randomWalk()
        Perform a random walk in the MDD. FOR TESTING PURPOSES
        Returns:
        A valid path in the MDD

      • stochasticRandomWalk

        public int[] stochasticRandomWalk​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Double> probabilities)

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear the MDD without freeing it. That is, remove and free all nodes from the layers, clear the domains and set the tt's pointer to null. The layers are kept.

      • addArc

        public void addArc​(Node source,
                   int value,
                   Node destination,
                   int layer)
        Add an arc between the source node and the destination node with the given value as label. Ensures the connection between the two nodes
        Parameters:
        source - The source node (parent)
        value - The value of the arc's label
        destination - The destination node (child)
        layer - The layer of the PARENT node (source)

      • removeArc

        public void removeArc​(Node source,
                      int value)
        Remove the arc from the source node with the given label's value. Ensures to delete references of this arc in both nodes.
        Parameters:
        source - The source node
        value - The value of the arc's label.

      • addArcAndNode

        public void addArcAndNode​(Node source,
                          int value,
                          Node destination,
                          int layer)
        Add the node destination to the given layer, and add an arc between the source node and the destination node with the given value as label.
        Parameters:
        source - The source node
        value - The value of the arc's label
        destination - The destination node - node to add in the MDD
        layer - The layer of the MDD where the node destination will be added

      • reduce

        public void reduce()
        Transform the MDD into a normal form (delete useless nodes, merge leaves, reduce).

      • removeChildless

        public void removeChildless()
        Remove all nodes from the MDD that do not have a child. This can be used as a pre-reduce operation to remove nodes from a MDD to free some memory, typically during an operation.
